page.title: 02TETTENHALL GREENS
page.content: Upper and Lower Greens,listed under the Commons Registration Act 1965,are today mainly used for recreation.The area was once forest land and many types of tree are still protected by Tettenhall Tree Preservation Order. Lower Green,historic centre of Tettenhall and formerly,site of Wakes Week,has seen few changes in recent years,though the A41 built in 1812 by the Town's Turnpike Trust,reduced its size.The sandstone ridge known as Tettenhall Rock separates the two greens. Upper Green is the focus of Tettenhall village.Its historic buildings,including the Clock Tower, must be in sympathy with their surroundings.A gift of land on the far side of A41 extended the green to 6 acres,now including a paddling pool.
